intro: Tanacetum okiense, commonly known as the Japanese tansy, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow button-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, camphor-like scent. Tanacetum okiense is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
